page.title: 03DANGER ON THE CLIFFS
page.content: {REPAIRING THE CLIFFS} A lot of work went into preserving one of Blackpool's natural features. The landslides on the cliffs were a potential deathtrap.They were poised to come down after a combination of sea-spray,weathering,plus the work associated with the illumination tableaux on top of the cliffs,had weakened them. Blackpool Borough Surveyers Department took the task of stabilizing the cliffs.This involved stopping deterioration with minimum inconvenience.Further problems were that the cliff surface was loosened by poor drainage,and water seeped through the surface to attack lower levels.If not prevented then the cliff face would deteriorate beyond repair. A lot of money was invested in this project,to keep the cliffs open.
